intro: Tetraplasandra lihuensis, commonly known as the Lihuena hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
